flawed_nl_solution:
The frame she initially intended to buy was 1/5*$60=${<<1/5*60=21>>}21 more expensive than she had thought.
This means the frame was being sold at $60+$21 = ${<<60+21=81>>}81
If she paid for a smaller frame at 3/4 the price of the frame she initially intended to buy, she paid 3/4*$81 = ${<<3/4*81=243/4>>}243/4
Yvette remained with $60-$243/4 = ${<<60-243/4=-3/4>>}-3/4

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 21. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
